page.title: 01General Description
page.content: {Rowlands Castle,}a suburban dormitory village occupies three of the north western blocks. The northern fringe of{Westbourne}is included in the south eastern square. The South western square is almost entirely filled by a portion of the large Leigh Park Housing estate known as{Sharp's Copse.} The seven remaining squares are rural and are almost evenly divided between woodland and grassland which is used for{dairy farming.} The land is gently undulating and the{soils}vary from upper chalk to Reading beds and London clay from North to South.
